Class ConsoleProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • ConsoleProgram

  • public class ConsoleProgram
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConsoleProgram

        public ConsoleProgram()
        Constructor for Console program. Create a scanner instance to be used for user input.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • run

        public void run()
        The run method is overwritten by the subclass. This is the main entry point for ConsolePrograms. There is no main method in student programs that extend ConsoleProgram, instead they write their application starting like this: public void run() { // student code here } The main method of ConsoleProgram calls this run method when it begins.

      • readLine

        public java.lang.String readLine(java.lang.String prompt)
        This method reads a line of input from the user, given a prompt.
        Parameters:
        prompt - A prompt to the user to get input
        Returns:
        A String of the user input.

      • readBoolean

        public boolean readBoolean(java.lang.String prompt)
        This method reads a boolean value from the user, asking them for either a true or false value. This makes use of the readLine method.
        Parameters:
        prompt - A prompt to the user to read a boolean value
        Returns:
        A boolean value read from the user.

      • readDouble

        public double readDouble(java.lang.String prompt)
        This method reads a double value from the user, given a prompt.
        Parameters:
        prompt - A prompt to the user to ask for a a double.
        Returns:
        A double value read from the user.

      • readInt

        public int readInt(java.lang.String prompt)
        This method reads a int value from the user, given a prompt.
        Parameters:
        prompt - A prompt to the user to ask for an int
        Returns:
        The int value read from the user.
